title: Ticket #7499: newline issue in token file
description:
Report from Mats Rynge:

I have had a couple of admins run into this small annoyance now, so I figured it was time to report it. When putting a newly generated token into a file, it seems you need a \n at the end. If not, you will get errors like: 

02/08/20 00:11:21 Calculating hkt 'submit@pool' (11),'condor_pool@condor-manager-db6f6cdf4-kqlzm' (42).
02/08/20 00:11:21 Hash supplied by server doesn't match that calculated by the client.
I think it would be good if reading these files were not newline sensitive.
remarks:
2020-Apr-10 07:46:37 by tim:
Bulk change of target version from v080906 to v080907 using ticket-target-mover.

2020-May-04 22:51:40 by bbockelm:
Turns out this was a really simple fix (and I've hit it a few times today); pushed a one-line fix.

2020-May-04 23:01:52 by zmiller:
CODE REVIEW: Looks good. Resolving.
check_ins: 2020-May-04 22:48   Check-in [59587]: Accept tokens without trailing newline. #7499 (By Brian Bockelman )
